alert.note: Alert for Central Middlesex County; Eastern Essex; Southeast Middlesex; Suffolk; Western Essex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 1:58PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Suffolk, central Essex and northeastern Middlesex Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 157 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Burlington, or near Woburn, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. Heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Urban and poor drainage flooding is possible in localized downpours. Locations impacted include... Boston, Lowell, Cambridge, Lynn, Lawrence, Somerville, Waltham, Malden, Medford, Revere, Peabody, Methuen, Arlington, Everett, Salem, Billerica, Beverly, Woburn, Chelsea and Chelmsford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle. This storm may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings.

area.areaDesc: Central Middlesex County; Eastern Essex; Southeast Middlesex; Suffolk; Western Essex
